intro: Sitanion, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sitanion is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
